result.execSummary:
The defendant Alecia M. Clifton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pertains to all counts: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.  Maintain absolute sobriety.   Submit DNA sample.  Complete psychological evaluation and comply with recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant deceased as of 3-21-18; unpaid court obligations of $787.35 and supervision fees of $540

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.
Filed by Atty Ron Benavides.

15CF473, 16CF27, 15CF307 & 16CF186, Defendant Alecia M. Clifton in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In 16CF186, 16CF27 & 15CF473. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Informations filed, reading waived. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1,4,7 in 15CF307, ct. 5 in 15CF473, ct. 1 in 16CF27, ct. 13 in 16CF186. Sentencing statements made. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 3 years probation in each case with conds:  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Complete psychological evaluation and comply with recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Court costs in 15CF307 - $518, $268, $268, in 15CF473 - $518, in 16CF27 - $518, in 16CF186 - $518. Additional condition in 16CF186 - 30 days jai, imposed & statyed, to be served during probation term and to be determined by agent.  Huber granted under jail rules. Jail credit to be determined.  All other counts, in all cases, read in and dismissed.

Cases called: 15CF473, 15CF307, 16CF27, 16CF186, Defendant appeared with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrants quashed in 16CF27 & 16CF186. Atty. Benavides requested cases be set for plea/sentencing hearing. Court stated to get them set in either Br. 1 or 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.
appointing attorney Ronald Benavides

Defendant, Alecia M. Clifton, appeared appeared by video with Attorney Alicia Nall, special for the public defender's office. Cliff Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $200 cash bond with not possess controlled substances without valid Rx, not possess/consume alcohol & felony conds. Time limits waived.  Warrant quashed in 15CM417.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:50 am.  Return date scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
